title: Defenitions
content:
Client vs. Server
Client: 
  • browser
  • codes are visible
  • doesn't require server to create data
Server: 
  • codes are invisible in page source
  • provide data to display on  browser,
  • not reside on browse
Languages and Data Formats
HTML (HyperText Markup Language)
  • formatting/building language for the web
  • denotes document structure
  • HTML5 includes new tags: semantic elements (header, footer, etc), attributes (date, time), graphic elements (svg, canvas), and multimedia (video, audio) 
CSS (Cascading Style Sheets)
  • stylize HTML documents
  • concise, specific notation of display/layout
JavaScript
  • add dynamic actions, interactivity to webpage
  • scripting language, interpreted and executed without compilation
  • executed while page loads
XML
  • like HTML, but without predefined tags
  • universal markup language for data exchange
  • tags & values, tree structure
  • separate content from appearance
JSON
  • alternative to XML, subset of JavaScript
  • lightweight, language independent data format
